API Documentation¶

System Interface¶

class pywfom.System(config=None)¶

Class wrapper for pywfom

Example

import pywfom

wfom = pywfom.System('path/to/config.json') # default.json used if empty

wfom.directory = 'path/to/data' # Path to save run data

wfom.acquire() # Saves data to wfom.directory

wfom.close() # Closes system
Parameters

config --

  • str : Path to local JSON Configuration File

  • dict : Configure from dictionary

  • None: Use Default Configuration

Variables

  • cameras (list) -- A list of pywfom.imaging.Camera's

  • arduino (object) -- pywfom.control.Arduino

  • user (str) -- Name of the user conducting the run

  • mouse (str) -- Name of the mouse used in the run

  • directory (str) -- Path to directory where Acquisition Files and a copy of the JSON Configuration File will be saved

  • runs (int) -- Number of runs to be carried out

  • run_length (float) -- Length of each run (in seconds)

acquire()¶

Begin acquiring Acquisition Files on your pywfom System.

close()¶

Close each pywfom.imaging.Camera and pywfom.control.Arduino

Camera Interface¶

class pywfom.imaging.Camera(device='test', index=0, **kwargs)¶

Interface for controlling Cameras using pywfom

Example

from pywfom.imaging import Camera

cam = Camera('webcam', 0) # Create webcam camera interface

cam.set(height=550, width=450, framerate=15.0) # Establish settings

print(cam.read()) # Print current frame

cam.close() # Close camera
Parameters

  • device (str) -- Type of camera (andor, spinnaker, webcam, or test)

  • index (int) -- Index of the camera

Variables

  • device (str) -- Type of Camera

  • index (int) -- Index of Camera

  • name (str) -- Name of Camera

  • height (int) -- Height of the camera frame

  • width (int) -- Width of the camera frame

  • offset_x (int) -- Leftmost pixel captured by the camera

  • offset_y (int) -- Bottommost pixel captured by the camera

  • binning (str) -- Dimensions of pixels to be combined and averaged, aka chunking (1x1, 2x2, 4x4, 8x8)

  • dtype -- dtype of the generated numpy array

  • master (bool) -- Determines whether the camera is self-triggered

  • framerate (float) -- Rate at which frames are captured (only used when pywfom.imaging.Camera.master is false)

close()¶

Closes the Camera Interface

get(setting=None)¶

Gets the current value of the specified setting

Parameters

setting (str) -- Setting value to be returned

get_max(setting)¶

Gets the maximum value of the specified setting

Parameters

setting (str) -- Maximum setting to be returned

get_min(setting)¶

Gets the minimum value of the specified setting

Parameters

setting (str) -- Minimum setting to be returned

read()¶

Read and return Camera's latest frame as a numpy array

set(**kwargs)¶

Establish camera settings either by including a configuration dictionary, or setting individual keyword arguments.

Parameters

  • config (dict) -- Dictionary containing multiple settings

  • device (string) -- Device type for the new Camera object.

  • name (string) -- (optional) Names the Camera object.

  • index (int) -- Sets the index Camera will connect to.

  • height (int) -- Sets the height of the Camera frame.

  • width (int) -- Sets the width of the Camera frame.

  • offset_x (int) -- Sets the width of the Camera frame.

  • offset_y (int) -- Sets the width of the Camera frame.

  • binning (string) -- Sets the binning of the Camera frame.

  • dtype (string) -- Sets the datatype of the Camera frame.

  • master (bool) -- Establishes whether Camera is self-triggered.

  • framerate (float) -- Sets the framerate the Camera read at

pywfom.imaging.error_frame(msg='')¶

Create an error frame displaying a specified message.

Parameters

msg (string) -- Message to be displayed on the error frame

pywfom.imaging.loading_frame(height=500, width=500)¶

Create a temporary frame displaying a 'loading' message.

Parameters

  • height (int) -- Height of the loading frame (in pixels)

  • width (int) -- Width of the loading frame (in pixels)

Arduino Interface¶

class pywfom.control.Arduino(port='COM1', **kwargs)¶

Methods pertaining to Communication with the Arduino

from pywfom.control import Arduino, list_ports

ports = list_ports() # Gather a list of available COM ports

port, name = ports[0] # Select the first port

ard = Arduino(port=port) # Connect to Arduino at specified port

ard.toggle_led(5) # Turn on LED at pin 5
set_leds(pins=None)¶

Set led strobe pins, an array of [2,3,4] sends p2p3p4p to the Arduino

Parameters

pins (list) -- List of pins to be considered LED drivers

set_trigger(pin=None)¶

Send command for setting trigger pin (i.e. t3)

start_strobing()¶

Turns on strobing on the Arduino

stop_strobing()¶

Turns off strobing on the Arduino

toggle_led(pin)¶

Turn on a specified LED

pywfom.control.list_ports()¶

Return a 2-item list of available COM Ports and their devices
